Description: Sherd of bowl and foot of pottery bowl or plate; low, broad foot, with slightly concave resting surface, which has a groove around the inside. Apparent orange-fired glaze on inside and partly preserved on underside of foot.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Curator's comments: Shape uncertain, but a larger vase; unlikely to be a lid, but it is not entirely excluded that it is a closed vase, though the surface of the inside scarcely aids that identification.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.728)
